title: Program configuration file
description: A schema file that describes a program can be started on a cluster

name.title: Program name
name.description: The name of the program that this configuration adds. A name must be unique among all of the program configurations that are loaded

executable.title: Executable
executable.description: The path to the executable that is started whenever this program should be executed on a cluster

commandlineParameters.title: Commandline Parameters
commandlineParameters.description: General commandline parameters that are added to the execution regardless of the configuration or the cluster that is selected

workingDirectory.title: Working Directory
workingDirectory.description: The working directory from which the executable will be started. If this value is not provided or it is the empty string, the working directory is the location of the executable

clusters.title: Clusters
clusters.description: The list of clusters on which this program can be executed. Each entry in this list shoul be the name of a valid cluster defined in a separate cluster configuration

items.title: Cluster
items.description: A cluster on which this program can be executed

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the cluster on which the program can be executed

parameters.title: Parameters
parameters.description: Additional commandline arguments that are only added when starting the program on this cluster

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: A list of tags associated to this program

items.title: Tag
items.description: A single tag associated with the program

description.title: Description
description.description: A human-readable description of the program. This information is not used directly, but presented to the user instead

shouldForwardMessages.title: Should Forward Console Messages
shouldForwardMessages.description: If this value is set to true, the process started on each node of the cluster will forward its console messages back to the C-Troll application make it possible to view them in a central location

enabled.title: Is Enabled
enabled.description: This signals to C-Troll whether the program configured is currently active or not. It is not possible start a disabled program and they will not show up in the list, behaving the same as if this configuration file does not exist.

delay.title: Startup Delay
delay.description: A delay in milliseconds that is added between starting the application on the nodes of a cluster.

configurations.title: Configurations
configurations.description: A list of different alternative configurations for the same program

items.title: Configuration
items.description: An individual description for this program

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the configuration. Two configurations for the same program must not use the same name

parameters.title: Parameters
parameters.description: Additional commandline parameters that are only added when this configuration is chosen

description.title: Description
description.description: A human-readable description of the configuration. This information is not used directly, but presented to the user instead
